metadata.title: CVE-2022-22637 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue isfixed in macOS Monterey 12.3, Safari 15.4, watchOS 8.5, iOS 15.4 and iPadOS15.4, tvOS 15.4. A malicious website may cause unexpected cross-originbehavior.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36.0-2ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
